bibl.idno: Papers of Jefferson Randolph Kean [manuscript] / Jefferson Randolph Kean, 1860-1950. MSS 628. The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia, Charlottesville, Va.

div1.p: This bill outlines a proposal to pay an annuity to the widow of Aristides Agramonte. [Courtesy of The Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia Library]

div1.head: Congressional Bill #S.4273, 72d Congress, 1st Session, March 23, 1932
div1.p: She died in Havana before this bill could be passed.
IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

Mr. LONG introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred
to the Committee on Military Affairs

To pay an annuity to Frances Agramonte, the widow of Doctor
Aristides Agramonte, member of the Yellow Fever
Commission.

1 Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representa-
2 tives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,
3 That there is hereby authorized to be appropriated, out of
4 any money in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated, such
5 amounts annually as may be necessary to pay, during the
6 remainder of her natural life, the sum of $125 per month to
7 Frances Agramonte, widow of Doctor Aristides Agramonte,
8 deceased, who was a member of the Yellow Fever Com-
9 mission, and whose name appears on the roll of honor of
10 the participants in the yellow fever investigations in Cuba,
2
1 published annually in the Army Register, said annuity being
2 the same heretofore paid to Doctor Aristides Agramonte,
3 pursuant to the provisions of the Public Act approved
4 February 28, 1929, entitled “An Act to recognize the high
5 public service rendered by Major Walter Reed and those
6 associated with him in the discovery of the cause and means
7 of transmission of yellow fever.”

To pay an annuity to Frances Agramonte, the
widow of Doctor Aristides Agramonte,
member of the Yellow Fever Commission.

Read twice and referred to the Committee on Military
Affairs
